>>Weather Chemnitz

In Chemnitz, the climatic conditions are categorized as mild and moderate. The precipitation levels in Chemnitz are noteworthy, as there is rainfall even during the most arid month. According to the Köppen-Geiger classification, the prevailing climate in this region is categorized as Cfb. The temperature in this location is approximately 8.6 °C | 47.4 °F, as determined by statistical analysis. Approximately 1011 mm | 39.8 inch of rainfall occurs on a yearly basis.

The specified area is located in the northern hemisphere of our planet. The onset of summer commences towards the conclusion of June and culminates by September. The season is characterized by a sequence of months, namely: June, July, August, September.

Climate graph // Weather by Month Chemnitz

During February, the amount of precipitation is at its lowest, with only 64 mm | 2.5 inch recorded. The month of July experiences the highest amount of precipitation, with an average value of 113 mm | 4.4 inch.

average temperature by month Chemnitz

The month of maximum warmth in a year is July. The average temperature during this period reaches up to 17.8 °C | 64.1 °F, making it the hottest time of the year. The month of January is characterized by the lowest temperatures, which have an average reading of -0.8 °C | 30.6 °F.

Total hours of sun

Within the region of Chemnitz, the month that experiences a maximum number of daily hours with bright sunshine is July exhibiting an average duration of approximately 10.23. In totality, there are about 317.01 hours worth of sunlight throughout this particular period.

On average, the location of Chemnitz experiences the least number of daily hours with sunshine during January. The total duration of sunlight in this period is recorded as 91.13, while an average of about 2.94 hours are received per day.

Throughout the year, Chemnitz experiences approximately 2337.81 hours of sunshine. The average monthly duration of sunlight is estimated to be around 76.7.
